Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.cardclasses

Class Powerup

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.cardclasses.Powerup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Card
    public class Powerup
extends java.lang.Object
implements Card
    This class represents all in-game powerups.

    Instances of this class will be used as components for Run-Time combinations of effects.

    See Also:
    FunctionalFactory

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Powerup()
      This constructor initializes all values to null.
      Powerup​(Color color, PowerupName name)
      This constructor initializes a powerup instance and its attributes values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Powerup

        public Powerup()
        This constructor initializes all values to null.

      • Powerup

        public Powerup​(Color color,
               PowerupName name)
        This constructor initializes a powerup instance and its attributes values.

        This constructor should be invoked only in a game setup phase.

        Parameters:
        color - a Color enumeration representing the powerup equivalent ammo value.
        name - a PowerupName enumeration representing the powerup identifier.

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public Color getColor()
        This method returns the equivalent ammo value of a powerup card.
        Returns:
        a Color enumeration that represent the equivalent ammo value of a powerup card.

      • getName

        public PowerupName getName()
        This method returns the powerup identifier.
        Returns:
        a PowerupName enumeration that identifies powerups.

      • setColor

        public void setColor​(Color color)
        This method sets a new value for color attribute.
        Parameters:
        color - a new Color to which the color attribute will be set.

      • setName

        public void setName​(PowerupName name)
        This method sets a new value for the name attribute.
        Parameters:
        name - a new PowerupName to which the name attribute will be set.
